creator: wilsoncychan@bigfoot.com
text:
I have tried hosting my project on Tomcat 4.1.24, 5.0.2 and 4.1.10 and they all 
crashed after sitting idle for > 6 hours. After I try out my JSP codes it seems 
that eversince this happens, the problem comes from the "session" object. and 
the following exception would be thrown:

HTTP Status 500 - 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

type Exception report

message 

description The server encountered an internal error () that prevented it from 
fulfilling this request.

creator: yannc76@yahoo.de
text:
There seems to be a problem in AfterLoginFrameSet.jsp, the JSP page is throwing 
an exception which is not handled by yourself. Can you provide the JSP 
sourcecode + explanation what you're trying to do on this page to verify the 
reason?

creator: wilsoncychan@bigfoot.com
text:
Created attachment 6907
JSP file that throws the exception in the description

creator: wilsoncychan@bigfoot.com
text:
Created attachment 6908
An included header file of AfterLoginMiddleFrame.jsp

creator: wilsoncychan@bigfoot.com
text:
This is in fact a very strange problem. It has never happened on Windows in the 
first place. And by closely looking at the exception description I don't think 
a JSP user would have anything to do with either a "Internal server error" or 
a "javax.servlet.ServletException".

creator: yannc76@yahoo.de
text: Cause has been located in webapp.
